intro: Psychotria pseudocollina, commonly known as the purple psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, glossy leaves and clusters of fragrant, white or purple flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Psychotria pseudocollina is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though further research is needed to confirm its medicinal properties.
